intro: Pistolochia solida subsp. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered pistolochia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, giving it its common name. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and the plant is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
